meanings.definition: A temporary structure used in construction work.
meanings.sent1: The workers built a scaffold to reach the top of the building.
meanings.sent2: The scaffold was essential for the construction of the new bridge.
meanings.sent3: When the birds landed on the scaffold, they had a great view of the city.
meanings.sent4: The scaffold of metal beams towered over the construction site like a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange scaffold against the blue sky made a striking image.

meanings.definition: A platform used for public speaking or execution.
meanings.sent1: The speaker stood on the scaffold to address the crowd.
meanings.sent2: In the past, public punishments were carried out on the scaffold.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that standing on the scaffold felt like a high-stakes performance.
meanings.sent4: The scaffold of justice loomed ominously in the town square.
meanings.sent5: The scaffold creaked under the weight of the speaker, adding tension to the atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A support or framework for holding materials during work.
meanings.sent1: The wooden scaffold provided a sturdy base for the bricks.
meanings.sent2: The painters used a scaffold to reach the high walls of the building.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the scaffold as a shortcut to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The scaffold of branches intertwined to create a natural ladder.
meanings.sent5: The metal scaffold gleamed in the sunlight, reflecting the hard work of the builders.
